Package game

Class Dinosaur

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
game.Dinosaur
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ActorInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
Allosaur, Stegosaur
public abstract class Dinosaur
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
This class is abstract and inherits and overrides some methods from the Actor class. This class includes all shared behaviours and functions between Stegosaur and Allosaur instances

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor

    displayChar, hitPoints, inventory, maxHitPoints, name

    This calls the Actor class constructor.

  • Constructor Details

    • Dinosaur

      public Dinosaur​(java.lang.String name, char displayChar, int hitPoints)
      This calls the Actor class constructor.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Actor
      displayChar - the character that will represent the Actor in the display
      hitPoints - the Actor's starting hit points

  • Method Details

    • getFoodLvl

      public int getFoodLvl()
      The current foodLvl of the dinosaur
      Returns:
      a integer type representing this.

    • setFoodLvl

      public void setFoodLvl​(int foodRaisingPoints)
      This method increases (eats food) or decreases the foodLvl of a dinosaur. This also is how we decrement the dinosaurs foodLvl by 1 each turn.
      Parameters:
      foodRaisingPoints - an integer representing a dinosaurs new food level

    • getNumTurnsUnconscious

      public int getNumTurnsUnconscious()
      Once the dinosaurs food level is below a certain number it turns unconscious. This tracks how many turns the dinosaur has been unconscious. Once this hits 0, the dinosaur will die.
      Returns:
      integer

    • setNumTurnsUnconscious

      public void setNumTurnsUnconscious​(int numTurnsUnconcious)
      Sets the number of turns since the dinosaur fell unconscious. Increases by 1 each turn the dinosaur has been unconscious.
      Parameters:
      numTurnsUnconcious - integer type

    • isUnconscious

      public boolean isUnconscious()
      A Boolean which indicates whether a dinosaur is unconscious or not. Will help us know when a dinosaur will die.
      Returns:
      boolean type.

    • setUnconscious

      public void setUnconscious​(boolean unconscious)
      Sets isUnconscious to true once a dinosaurs food level hits 0.
      Parameters:
      unconscious - boolean type

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether a dinosaur is dead.
      Returns:
      boolean type.

    • setDead

      public void setDead​(boolean dead)
      Sets isDead to true if a dinosaur has had its foodLvl be 0 for 20 or more turns. Lets us now that a dinosaur should be deleted from the game.
      Parameters:
      dead - boolean to indicate if a dinosaur is dead or not.

    • getNumTurnsDead

      public int getNumTurnsDead()
      Tells us how many turns a dinosaur has been dead. Initially this is 0 and increases each turn since being unconscious for 20 or more turns.
      Returns:
      integer

    • setNumTurnsDead

      public void setNumTurnsDead​(int numTurnsDead)
      Sets the number of turns a dinosaur carcass has been on the ground. Since a dinosaur carcass is still edible for a certain number of turns, we need to track this.
      Parameters:
      numTurnsDead - updated number of times carcass has remained on ground

    • getGender

      public java.lang.String getGender()
      Indicates the dinosaurs gender to let us know whether two dinosaurs can mate or not.
      Returns:
      string type indicating dinosaur gender

    • setGender

      public void setGender​(java.lang.String gender)
      This is randomised and theres a 50% chance of the dinosaur either being male or female.
      Parameters:
      gender - integer type where 1 = female and 2 = male

    • playTurn

      public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action playTurn​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actions actions, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action lastAction, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Display display)
      A method returning a collection of possible actions for this actor.
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Actor
      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Actor
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      the Action to be performed

    • getNumTurnsPregnant

      public int getNumTurnsPregnant()
      Used on female dinosaurs indicating how long its been since breeding with another dinosaur. Once this hits 10, the female dinosaur will lay an egg.
      Returns:
      integer type

    • setNumTurnsPregnant

      public void setNumTurnsPregnant​(int numTurnsPregnant)
      Increases by 1 each turn since the female dinosaur has mated
      Parameters:
      numTurnsPregnant - new value to be set to

    • isPregnant

      public boolean isPregnant()
      Returns true or false whether or not a female dinosaur is expected to lay an egg.
      Returns:
      boolean type

    • setPregnant

      public void setPregnant​(boolean pregnant)
      This is set to true for a female dinosaur once it has mated with another male dinosaur.
      Parameters:
      pregnant - boolean type

    • getStage

      public java.lang.String getStage()
      This indicates the stage of life a dinosaur is currently at. Either baby or adult.
      Returns:
      String type

    • setStage

      public void setStage​(java.lang.String stage)
      Sets the stage of the dinosaur. This is initially adult for the starting herd of the game. But for a hatching dinosaur egg, the dinosaur born will have its stage set as baby.
      Parameters:
      stage - String type.

    • breed

      public static boolean breed​(Dinosaur d1, Dinosaur d2)
      This method checks whether both dinosaurs meet the breeding requirements. If they do, the female will get pregnant and eventually lay an egg of the same type.
      Parameters:
      d1 - A dinosaur of the same type as d2
      d2 - A dinosaur of the same type as d1
      Returns:
      A boolean to indicate whether breeding was successful or not.

    • newTick

      public static void newTick​(Dinosaur d, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location l, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap gameMap)
      This method ticks all the dinosaurs across the gamemap. This includes ageing a baby dinosaur, setting the new food levels, breeding, attacks etc.
      Parameters:
      d - The current dinosaur being ticked
      l - The location of the dinosaur at the current moment
      gameMap - The gameMap in which the dinosaur resides in

    • getNumTurnsAlive

      public int getNumTurnsAlive()
      This method returns the number of turns a dinosaur has been alive. This is only relevant for baby dinosaurs and so the starting herd of stegosaurs ignore this attribute entirely.
      Returns:
      an integer indicating how long a dinosaur has been alive. Only applicable to baby dinosaurs which have hatched from eggs.

    • setNumTurnsAlive

      public void setNumTurnsAlive​(int numTurnsAlive)
      This method increases each turn since a baby dinosaur was born. This attribute only applies to baby dinosaurs which hatched from an egg.
      Parameters:
      numTurnsAlive - an incremental integer which increases by 1 each turn

    • randomiseGender

      public java.lang.String randomiseGender()
      This method randomises the given gender for a stegosaur or allosaur instance
      Returns:
      a string of either male or female
